CatDescriptText: Arlene Ryan, secretary, New Cumberland, W. Va and Ricco Leans, sales manager, Bellevue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" Arlene Ryan's answer reads: "....broken homes."  Ricco Leans' answer reads: "I think it's the lack of good home training which is the major cause of juvenile delinquency."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Group portrait of two women, including Arlene Ryan wearing dark dress, three strand beaded necklace, and sunglasses, standing in front of Gilbert's store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Ricco Leans wearing hat, eyeglasses, and striped necktie, standing in front of building
